>*coder mode on*
> >Basically, the above answer: the elemental's values are set based on its
> >owners; some part of the formula which determines how powerful it is ends
> >up "looping" over the maximum value.
>
>"Of course, since players should never have stats that high, it shouldn't
>be a problem." ;)
>
>And, of course, it's been documented now, so it's a FEATURE, not a BUG. ;)
>*coder mode off*
>
>-George "Cookie" Phillips
>AnimeNewsNetwork.com
>Editor-In-Chief

*grin*  Yeah, basically :)  There are actually a number of cases in which 
having stats above a certain level can make the game go goofy.  We tried to 
pick out the ones that were most game-affecting (things like freezing time 
for an infinite duration, etc.), but there were always more that we just 
ignored :) Eventually, we played through the levels "normally" several 
times, attempting to get stats as high as possible.  We made sure 
everything worked in those "normal" (ie, non-cheating, no 
special-levels-designed-for-exp-boosting) circumstances .. that way we 
could make sure we'd fixed anything players would find "in the normal 
course of the game," and we figured that anything else, players could do 
(and experience) as they like ;-)

--Tom
